alert.note: Alert for Motherlode; West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 25 at 1:25AM PST until March 01 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST EARLY THIS MORNING... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE TUESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, snow with additional accumulations of 1 to 3 inches and winds gusting as high as 35 mph. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 2 feet possible above 2000 feet and 3 to 7 feet above 3000 feet. Winds could gust as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...Motherlode and West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 4 AM PST early this morning. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Sunday morning through late Tuesday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible with extended road closures. Blowing snow will cause white-out conditions at times. Downed trees and tree limbs and local power outages are possible due to heavy snow and gusty winds. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels 2500 to 3500 feet Sunday falling to 2000 to 3000 feet Monday. Periods of heavy snow Sunday with snow showers lingering into Sunday night. Another round of heavy snow is expected Monday into early Wednesday.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Motherlode; West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada
